title: Add post-presale listings section (Listings After the Presale)

requirements.summary: Create a new neon/glow-styled landing-page section describing planned token listings after the presale using English-only copy.
acceptanceCriteria: A new section is visible on the page with a clear heading such as "Listings After the Presale".
All text in the new section is in English.
The section styling is consistent with existing sections (same container widths, card styling, neon accents, readable contrast).

file_operations.description: Add a new "Listings After the Presale" section component using the existing container/max-width patterns and neon card styling used by current sections; keep all user-facing text in English. Use shadcn-ui primitives (e.g., Badge) for status pills if available to match design consistency—Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

requirements.summary: Make the listings section conditional on presale status (active vs ended) with a safe fallback when status is unavailable.
acceptanceCriteria: When presale status indicates active=true, the listings section displays an English message indicating listings will be announced after the presale ends.
When presale status indicates active=false, the listings section displays the post-presale listings content.
The page remains usable if presale status data is temporarily unavailable (no rendering crash; show a short English fallback message).

file_operations.description: Integrate presale-state awareness by consuming the existing usePresaleStatus hook; render (1) a clear "not yet" message when status.active is true, (2) the listings cards when status.active is false, and (3) a short English fallback when status data is loading/errored/unavailable to avoid render crashes.

requirements.summary: Wire the new listings section into the single-page flow in App.tsx between Tokenomics/FAQ and Footer without changing existing sections.
acceptanceCriteria: The listings section renders below Tokenomics & FAQ and above the Footer in the single-page layout.
No existing sections are removed or reordered (beyond inserting this new section).
Build passes and the app loads without console errors related to the new section.

file_operations.description: Import and render PostPresaleListingsSection directly after <TokenomicsFaq /> and before <Footer />, preserving the existing section ordering and behavior otherwise.

requirements.summary: Define post-presale listing items in a typed, centralized data structure and render them as cards with a status indicator without claiming real exchanges by default.
acceptanceCriteria: Listings items are driven from a centralized data structure (not hard-coded repeatedly in markup).
Each listing item renders a title and a status label.
No specific real-world exchanges are claimed by default unless explicitly provided later.

file_operations.description: Create a small typed constant list (e.g., ListingItem[] with title, description (optional), and status such as Planned/In Progress/Announced) containing only generic placeholders (no real exchange names by default) so updates can be made without rewriting JSX.

Render listing items from the centralized constants file into a responsive card grid with a clear status indicator (e.g., shadcn-ui Badge or equivalent styling without modifying immutable ui files)—Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.
